Pre-Game Insights: West African neighbours Benin and Nigeria battle in Monday's World Cup qualifying match at Stade Felix-Houphouet-Boigny.
Gernot Rohr could inflict even more misery on his old side when his current one host the three-time African champions on Monday.
Rohr hopes his side give everything to build on the recent 1-0 triumph over Rwanda that elevated them to third in the standings, one ahead of the Super Eagles.
The Cheetahs hope to be beneficiaries of the extra day's rest, keen to end the Super Eagles' undefeated start to qualifying.
Finidi George's men have played 1-1 draws in qualifying against Lesotho, Zimbabwe and South Africa.

George's men can put their three consecutive draws behind them by defeating Benin in Abidjan, potentially taking the Super Eagles top of the group if South Africa are unsuccessful against Zimbabwe and Lesotho and Rwanda play out a stalemate.
Nigeria must get their act together and avoid being absent in consecutive editions for the first time since their maiden appearance in 1994.
